title: Enter Camilla, a modern and complex queen
description: From mistress, to duchess, to queen, Camilla's progression reflects that of an evolving British culture and tradition.

title: Michelle Obama launches a food company aimed at healthier choices for kids
description: Kids in the U .S. consume a lot of sugar - nearly 53 pounds a year on average.  Obama's new food company PLEZi Nutrition, will lower the sugar content and improve nutrition in products aimed at kids.

title: El Niño is coming. Here's what that means for weather in the U.S.
description: Warmer sea waters have many far-ranging effects. In the new pattern, some parts of the U.S. could get relief from drought, while others might see fewer hurricanes.

title: It'll take 300 years to wipe out child marriage at the current pace of progress
description: UNESCO's new report on child marriages shows signs of progress. Yet each year, 12 million girls marry before they turn 18. And the pandemic, climate change and conflict has only made things worse.

title: 8th-graders' history and civics scores drop on a national test
description: Jonathan Collins, a professor of political science, public policy and education at Brown University, talks about the so-called "Nation's Report Card" on civics and U.S. history.

title: Crises like climate change and COVID hamper efforts to curb child marriage
description: Twelve million girls become brides every year, says a UNICEF report. In recent years, conflicts, climate change and COVID-19 have pushed more families into poverty, driving up child marriages.

title: From 'the other woman' to Queen: how Camilla turned her image around
description: Tina Brown, author of The Palace Papers, talks about Camilla's journey to queen, legitimacy, and how she'll approach the role.

title: JPMorgan Chase banks on its new HQ being 'a destination'
description: JPMorgan Chase is building a multibillion-dollar headquarters in New York City, designed by one of the most famous architects in the world. The bank hopes it will be a model for a post-pandemic workplace.

title: National student assessment has educators and legislators worried
description: Every four years, the U.S. gets a look at how students around the country are doing in civics and history education. The latest snapshot has educators and legislators worried.

title: Port Sudan is a refuge for foreigners and families trying to escape the fighting
description: A look at a trip for Sudan evacuees from Port Sudan to Jeddah, Saudi Arabia.

title: Senator says the Supreme Court should 'take the hint' on code of conduct
description: Independent Sen. Angus King of Maine talks about efforts to create a binding code of conduct for the Supreme Court.

title: U.S. anticipates an increase in asylum seekers as Title 42 is set to end
description: Title 42, which allows the US to reject asylum seekers without a hearing, is set to end May 11. President Biden is sending troops to the border in anticipation of an increase in asylum seekers there.

title: What's at stake for TV and movie writers who went on strike this week
description: TV writer and Writers Guild of America member Jeane Phan Wong talks about what writers want and what's getting in the way.

title: Trials have become an endangered species. A new effort is trying to change that
description: Advocates say defendants who go to trial face much longer prison sentences — a so-called trial penalty. It can even lead innocent people to strike plea deals.

title: These states are narrowly defining who is 'female' and 'male' in law
description: LGBTQ advocates say these bills are another attempt to restrict transgender rights. Republicans sponsoring the bills say the definitions are important to keep sex from being conflated with gender.

title: Pakistan's trans community shows love for 'Joyland' — but worries about a backlash
description: The film, which shows a relationship between a married man and a transgender woman, has opened in the U.S.. It's won awards and raves. But in Pakistan's trans community, some see a possible downside.

title: 1 dead and at least 4 injured in Atlanta shooting. Police say the shooter is at large
description: One person was killed and at least four others injured after a gunman opened fire in a downtown Atlanta medical office building, police said. The shooter is still at large, police said.

title: The Fed raises interest rates again in what could be its final attack on inflation
description: The Federal Reserve raised interest rates by a quarter percentage point Wednesday in an effort to curb persistent inflation. It was the tenth rate hike in 14 months, and possibly the last for a while.

title: A meteorologist's Facebook comments about guns and kids alarm his audience
description: The founder of iWeatherNet, a Facebook page and website that posts updates about Dallas-Fort Worth and Atlanta-area weather, commented about being armed and impatient when a child rang his doorbell.

title: Brazil police raid ex-President Bolsonaro's home in COVID vaccine card investigation
description: Police raided former President Jair Bolsonaro's home, investigating claims of suspected efforts to falsify vaccination records to travel to the U.S. He denies any role in allegedly forging documents.

title: This star ate its own planet. Earth may share the same fate
description: For the first time, astronomers have caught a star in the act of swallowing a planet, providing a glimpse into how the sun may eventually eat up Earth.

title: Russia alleges Ukraine tried to attack the Kremlin in a Putin assassination attempt
description: Russian authorities said Ukraine tried to attack the Kremlin overnight with two drone strikes in an alleged attempt to assassinate President Vladimir Putin.

title: 'Shy' follows the interior monologue of a troubled teen boy
description: Max Porter's compulsively readable primal scream of a novel offers a compassionate portrait of boy jerked around by uncontrollable mood swings that lead to self-sabotaging decisions.

title: Eight children are dead and a student is in custody after a school shooting in Serbia
description: A 14-year-old is in custody after opening fire at a school in Belgrade, police say. Mass shootings in Serbia are rare, but the Balkans are awash in weapons left over from wars in the 1990s.

title: Jack Lew had a front-row seat to debt ceiling fights under Obama. Here's his advice
description: The U.S. came dangerously close to defaulting on its debt in 2011. Jack Lew, chief of staff and then treasury secretary under President Obama, offers some advice to the current administration.

title: The debate over raising the debt ceiling is the latest in such political stalemates
description: NPR's A Martinez talks to Jack Lew, chief of staff and then treasury secretary under President Obama. In 2013 he saw how a president and Congress can work a standoff for political advantage.

title: A court in Belarus sentences a dissident journalist to 8 years in prison
description: Raman Pratasevich and his Russian girlfriend were arrested in May 2021 when their Ryanair flight from Greece to Lithuania was ordered to land in the capital of Belarus, Minsk.

title: From mini rooms to streaming, things have changed since the last big writers' strike
description: From "mini rooms" to the explosion of streaming, the media landscape has evolved significantly. Now it's heading for a new reckoning.

title: Desperate migrants are choosing to cross the border through dangerous U.S. desert
description: The humanitarian aid group Border Kindness leaves water and other aid in areas along the U.S.-Mexico border. They say people are ill-prepared for conditions on uncharted trails.

title: Schools ended universal free lunch. Now meal debt is soaring
description: Across the country, schools are reporting rising cafeteria debt, and fewer kids are enrolling in their free and reduced price programs. Many states are moving to make meals free for all kids again.

title: Who is Kemal Kilicdaroglu, a leading challenger to Erdogan in Turkey's election?
description: Here is a look at the man expected to be the top challenger to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan's 20-year rule in the May 14 Turkish election, and what sets him apart.

title: Americans aren't thrilled with the government. The Supreme Court is just one example
description: Republicans are lambasting Democrats' attempts at uniform ethics standards at the Supreme Court as partisan politics. It's just the latest chapter in a decline in national unity.

title: 3 stabbings — 2 of them fatal — rattle a quiet California college town
description: The Davis, California, police chief said he could not say whether officials are searching for one or multiple suspects.

title: A Seattle professor died during a hike up Mount Everest
description: The U.S. citizen did not die from a climbing-related accident or inclement weather, his group said. Mount Everest, located across Nepal and Tibet, is the world's highest point above sea level.

title: History and civics scores drop for U.S. eighth-graders on national test
description: On the "Nation's Report Card, history scores were the lowest ever, and civics showed the first decline ever.

title: The Texas man accused of killing 5 neighbors is in custody, authorities say
description: The suspect, 38-year-old Francisco Oropesa, fled the scene, leading law enforcement on a massive manhunt over more than three days. The shooting seemed to be spurred by a noise complaint.

title: Elon Musk threatens to re-assign @NPR on Twitter to 'another company'
description: Musk, who has been scuffling with the media since acquiring the platform last year, asked if NPR was going to start tweeting again.
